newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China steel firm plans IPO of 70 mln A shares.
newsitem.headline: China steel firm plans IPO of 70 mln A shares.

text.p: Daye Special Steel Co Ltd plans to make an initial public offering of 70 million A shares through the Shenzhen exchange's automated quotation system in the near future, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
China's largest brokerage Shenyin & Wanguo Securities Co Ltd has been named as the main underwriter for the offer, he told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin.
The precise time and pricing had not been not fixed, he said.
Daye, based in Huangshi city in central Hubei province, plans to issue B shares after the A share offer, the official said, adding that plans for the second-batch equity issue had yet to be drafted.
Daye is one of 33 enterprises that have been approved by the Securities Commission of China's State Council, or cabinet, to list B shares.
The official said Daye would put the A share proceeds into the ongoing construction of a steel plant which became partially operational early in 1997, he said, giving no other details on the project.
He declined to provide profit figures for recent years.
Daye currently has total share capital of 209.22 million shares, composed of 171.22 million state shares, 15.2 million legal person shares and 22.8 million staff shares.
